alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Somerset; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Somerset, eastern Monmouth and Middlesex Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Manville to Old Bridge to East Freehold. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Long Branch, Somerville, Sandy Hook, Somerset, Edison, Middletown, Old Bridge, Howell, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Marlboro, Carteret, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Middlesex, Red Bank and Bound Brook. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 41. Interstate 195 in New Jersey near mile marker 29. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 18. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 104 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern and central New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Somerset; Western Monmouth
